<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 1"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Fiendish Lore](/Feats.aspx?ID=1378) <actions string="" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Tiefling" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=258" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Advanced Player's Guide](/Sources.aspx?ID=39) pg. 39 <sup>2.0</sup></row>

</column>

---

You were raised by a tiefling or a fiendish relative, or you've devoted yourself to researching the secrets of the fiendish realms. You gain the trained proficiency rank in [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) and [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13). If you would automatically become trained in one of those skills (from your background or class, for example), you instead become trained in a skill of your choice. You also become trained in a [Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) skill related to the fiendish plane from which you trace your lineage (usually [Abaddon](/Planes.aspx?ID=12) Lore, [Abyss](/Planes.aspx?ID=13) Lore, or [Hell](/Planes.aspx?ID=18) Lore).
